pros: - Opportunities to help others - opportunities to take on paid over time

pros: Good pay for health and social care
cons: Call you out of hours No support from higher management Manipulative to make you do things you don’t want to do Pay checks wrong Expect staff to just do overtime without asking can sometimes do 48 hour shifts Higher management do not listen to staff when they tell them what’s going on within service and ask for help just say your fully staffed what’s the problem. Let service users rule the roost and dictate what staff members they have Service users seem to have more communication with higher management then staff members High management do not help in stressful situations when asked for help I could go on long story short do not work here’

review_title: Good to gain experience in challenging behaviour background.

pros: Nice people. Good managers. You get to know everyone and it’s alright

review_title: Good experience but not good company
job_title: Support Worker in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: I got great experience in this role working with a range of different service users and the coworkers were great too
cons: Company does not care about staff morale. Staff turnover is constant and staff that remain have to pick up the slack. Challenging behaviours were difficult at times to deal with.

job_title: Support Worker in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Rewarding but challenging with very little to no support from management.
cons: Long and unsociable hours with little training.

job_title: Support Worker in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: If you're passionate about care but other than that there's no pros to this job at all
cons: No benefit, long hours, bad management, no career opportunities

pros: Environment is great to work
cons: Not good salary for the role

review_title: there's no growth there's no growth

job_title: Support Worker in Warrington, North West England, England

job_title: Support Worker in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: The team - the service I worked in fortunately had a wonderful team who really cared about the service users
cons:
Poor management and communication with staff 
Low pay relative to the hours, stress and job conditions
Management and higher ups do not care one bit about staff mental well-being
Long hours with shift/rota changes made very last minute
Seniors became very ‘cliquey’ and created a hostile and intimidating environment to work in

review_title: Great local employer offering an excellent service
pros: Other staff and service users
cons: Communication - but no worse than other employers!

pros:
Great Service Users 
Good training opportunities
cons: Management is lacking, the company would be great if it were not for the current management.

pros: Rewarding Job and Great colleagues
cons: Not many cons to be fair, decent company to work for.

pros: Many good hearted people are working in the company as support staff
cons: Management is incompetent and never have time to actually run the service. They are scared of managing people and in result plenty of staff is just lazing around and other staff members need to constantly work for them. Service users are less important to them than appearance that "all is good".

pros: Good pay and excellent training programme. And lots of overtime
cons: I can't think of any. I like working here

pros: great place to work and to gain some experience however i know they can do better
cons: great place to work and to gain some experience

job_title: Waking Nights Support Worker in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Very good company to work for when the management is listening to their employees. Really enjoyed working with all my colleagues.
cons: Dealing with parents' views and requests can be overwhelming at times.

pros:
relationship with service user

job_title: Support Worker in Warrington, North West England, England
pros: Some staff can make it worthwhile if you get a good team. Sleeps are paid. Can be rewarding and gives a sense of pride when an achievement is reached.
cons:
Awful pay, no consideration for your well-being, both physical and mental. Long unsociable hours, every incident is staffs fault- always. Training is irrelevant, and long winded. Repetitive paperwork, hard to see a reason/any relevance for some of it.
High staff turnover due to pay and working conditions, most get fed up and leave because you are dispensable, and its clear management believe this.

job_title: Residential Support Worker in Southport, England
pros: Good service users. Fun activities
cons: Poor management, lack of support

job_title: Floating Support Worker in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Good hours, manageable work load
cons: Not paid enough for the work you do

pros: Shift work and good training
cons: High turnover of staff Staff unreliable for handover of shifts

pros: Absolutely nothing good to say about this company. A culture of bullying exists throughout, making them miserable employers.
cons: Terrible management who have no clue how to people management

pros: Management leave u alone until there’s an issue
cons: Management don’t care. Look after themselves not clients or employees

pros: Annual leave thats all i can think of
cons: Management, hr, need to be trained in communication

review_title: Loved working with the service users
pros:
Working with the service users is amazing. Such a range of different people and experiences. Very rewarding when you feel like you’re making a difference.
Good staff team in the residential setting I worked in as well. Good fun.
Training is good.
cons:
Lack of support from head office. I don’t feel like they’d have my back should something occur and aren’t very sympathetic. Seem to place their money-making needs as a priority at times and don’t seem to respect those at ground level who are actually supporting the most important thing, the service users.
At ground level, the hours and pay aren’t great. Challenging behaviour isn’t for everybody but the training packages are there to support that.

review_title: Not bad interim job, poor management
pros: Largely flexible even if you have to fight for any changes you want. They abide by their minimum legal requirement for the treatment of staff who are off I'll.
cons: Terrible management. They are either not present at all or are so ideologically driven that they are completely blind to the way they are hobbling their staffs ability to conduct their jobs safely with their newest great "ideas".

pros:
Lots of training available 
Good support from senior staff
Good environment to work in
Work towards NVQ
Opportunity to progress in your career.
Guaranteed one weekend a month.
Benefits for employees (ride to work, childcare vouchers)
cons:
Pay is low
May be asked to work long hours
Only £33 per over night sleep.
Can be moved to different location as and when needed.

review_title: Exciting work and lots of opportunity
job_title: Autism Support Worker in Edinburgh, Scotland
pros: Everyone really cares about clients and improving quality of life for people with autism.  Managers are always available.  Excellent training.
cons: Schedule was unpredictable.  Carers often we're expected to take risks that not everyone would be comfortable taking. Community based intervention can be stressful.

pros: Enjoyed working with service users and meeting people. I am really struggling to think of anything positive to say about this company.
cons: Just about everything. Poor pay, minimum wage only. Staff training is virtually non-existent and consists largely of watching DVDs. There are no fringe benefits, they won't even provide you with a free meal while doing a 24 hour shift. No breaks provided either. Bullying is endemic within AI. Standard of care provided borders on neglect.

job_title: Support Worker in Sunderland, North East England, England
pros: Great service users to support
cons: Rubbish man age mentioned. .no idea how to support sitting behind their computers. . So easy for them to take advantage of good staff when can't cover shifts..I did average 70 hours a week over 5 year period with no thanks.. I think this company should be sanctioned over poor management of staff. Too many good staffeta left and replaced with young inexperienced people.

pros: staff and service users are great
cons: no flexible working when they there is. They offered me waking night as flexible working I have 3 kids. Management don't listen. their training videos  are so out of date like 1992 . I can write an essay on their shortcoming and failing

review_title: I'd say seriously think about it, read my review..

Some great staff members

cons:
A clicky culture that if your not in the click then your tossed aside.

called at all hours (6am) etc to see if I would work

pros: Working with some great clients made the shift.
cons:
Managers don't care what happens at the service as long as its staffed.

If you have a grievence it won't get further than your line manager, and then I wouldn't want to be in your shoes.

Expected to work all hours for no pay. Managers had a complete lack of experience. 

AVOID.

review_title: No pay rise too many chiefs not enough Indians too much paper work head office don't respect the staff
